statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: American 67, Vermont 64
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP)-- Jason Thomas matched a career-high with 23 points and grabbed 11 rebounds, leading American to a 67-64 win over Vermont on Saturday afternoon. Andre Ingram added 19 for the Eagles (3-2), who led Vermont (2-2) by eight with 6:31 to play, but a late free throw nearly cost American its seventh straight home win. T.J. Sorrentine led the Catamounts with 27 points and Taylor Coppenrath scored 22 points, grabbed 15 rebounds and hit an unlikely 3-pointer with 2.1 seconds left to pull Vermont to 66-64. Thomas made a free throw with 1.6 seconds left and intercepted Vermont's desperation pass to seal the win. The Eagles were able to limit Coppenrath in the first half, holding the Naismith Award candidate to seven points and five rebounds. Vermont had to settle for 31 3-point attempts in the game, including 5-of-13 shooting from long range by Sorrentine. American turned the ball over 16 times and missed five of its 10 free throw attempts in the final 1:01, but the defense held Vermont without a field goal for two key stretches to protect the lead. Sorrentine's drive through the lane with 5:14 left cut American's lead to 54-51, but the Catamounts didn't hit another shot from the floor until there was 1:04 left when they were down nine. The Eagles also held Vermont, which had two one-point leads for a total of 56 seconds, without a field goal for the final 3:44 of the first half to take a 30-25 lead.
